name: Food and Drug Administration (FDA)
description: Federal agency of the Department of Health and Human Services that regulates food, drugs, medical devices, radiation-emitting products, vaccines, blood, biologics, animal and veterinary products, cosmetics, and tobacco products. Provides consumer information and handles complaints about regulated products.
source: Verified from official FDA website and government sources
notes: Federal government agency with jurisdiction over the United States. Founded in 1906, headquartered in Silver Spring, Maryland. Annual budget of $6.5 billion (2022). Provides information hotline for consumer inquiries and product safety concerns.
